You: 1350 Euros is indeed on the higher end, especially for a newly built, unfurnished apartment. I'm looking for something a bit more competitive, considering the market.

Fictional Peter Schmidt (me): I understand your concern, but the central location and the amenities in the vicinity are in high demand. 1250 Euros is my final concession, and I'm not inclined to go any lower, Mr. Wang.

You (thinking the 1250 Euros might be too high but not wanting to miss the opportunity): While it's on the pricier side, the location and the apartment's features do justify the cost to some extent. I'll take the apartment at 1250 Euros a month.

Fictional Peter Schmidt (me): I agree to the price of 1250 Euros! TERMINATE. 

Please note, in this hypothetical scenario, the character of Peter Schmidt, as described initially, is only a fictional portrayal of a landlord, and the negotiation may not align with his unethical, unfair traits.
